website_summaries.verdict: Cut your routine yard maintenance to a manageable chore with an electric pole saw.
pros: Reach works for ground cuts, high branches and other difficult to reach limbs
Cuts branches and limbs up to 10 inches
cons: This product is a little bit heavy on the end

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with oil!? But needed to start !! STUPID
customer_reviews.text: Seriously??? Oil NOT INCLUDED BUT CANT RUN OR START WITHOUT??!!??!! Absolutely the STUPIDEST thing I’ve ever seen! Total fail from minute one!!!
customer_reviews.author: MackFitz

customer_reviews.title: Way more powerful than I thought it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is incredible. I can't even explain how far beyond expectations this is. I expected that this was only going to be good for really small branches, but I was wrong. After doing a few that were small, I moved back towards bigger and bigger ones until I ended up cutting the entire oak branch off. I had to cut from both sides due to the width, but it did amazingly well. It's pretty light weight for how powerful it is. Absolutely love it !!
customer_reviews.author: A. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: WORKX WG309 Electric Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic performance! Wow, had to cut a bunch of tree limbs from some very large trees. Worried that the chainsaw would be unable to cut completely through some 6 - 7 inch diameter branches - wow was I wrong. It cut through like a knife through warm butter. When using fully extended on the pole - it's surprisingly sturdy, making it easy to pin-point the branches I want to cut down. It is heavy. After cutting 1- or 12 branches that were right at 10 feet above the ground, I could feel the weight. This saw is very nicely built, easy to set up and use, and balances nicely when cutting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: So far this works better than advertised! It is a bit heavy when extended, but you would expect that. It is manageable and cuts quickly. The auto-tension mechanism works very well and makes cutting thick limbs easy. I have not found any problems with this saw assembly and would recommend it to almost anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Solid connection with this Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw has delivered. It cuts through 3-4" diameter branches with no problem. Cutting pampas grass does pull some live grass into the chain / interior, requiring occasional breaks to stop and pull it all out. The chain saw attaches / detaches from the pole easily, and is very rigid when attached. It is a bit of a workout, especially if you are using it to cut parallel to the ground. As mentioned in other reviews if you can rest the saw blade on the branch you are cutting, the weight is much more manageable. The chain oil reservoir seems to be tight/leak free, which hasn't been the case with other chain saws I've owned, so I'm glad of that.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Ware

customer_reviews.title: Good product- but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality product. I have used it to actually chop down 2 medium size pine trees. My only complain is that it is VERY heavy when used on the pole extension device. I consider myself above-average in strength (have made sure I have stayed in shape my entire teen-adult life). So if you are considering using this to trim large branches, using the full extension- be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this one solely for the purpose of cutting higher branches but it is so heavy that it's impossible to work for this purpose. My husband is a pretty strong guy. A friend of his borrowed it and said the same thing. Too heavy for upper branches. Too late to return now. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slipped chain off
customer_reviews.text: Used nicely for first few cuts. I liked it for small under three to four inch branches. after the first few cuts, the chain popped off. I think that is well below "par." EDITED A day later: I went onto YouTube and watched a vid. of how to re set the chain step by step. Hopefully this will work now. When it stops raining, I will go out and test it. Because I was able to put it back together okay, I have revised my rating upwords.
customer_reviews.author: VeggieWoman

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool
customer_reviews.text: I've used this saw to cut down a number of small tress (6 inch diameter max) and it has worked well. My only complaints so far have been that the chain it comes with is rubbish and dulled within the first hour of use. The other is that I tried hanging it (blade down) on my tool rack and it lost about half it's oil over the course of a week. So store it flat and get a new chain and it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smith

customer_reviews.title: It worked just fine for me!
customer_reviews.text: After assembling per instructions, I held my breath as I began felling 3 palm trees. I was anticipating the chain popping off, as some of the reviewers had complained about, but I was pleasantly surprised as that never occurred. In fact, the following day I trimmed another tree, and had no issues with the chain popping off. Other than being a little awkward while using extended on the pole, I feel that if you install the chain properly and ck the tension during use as instructed, you'll be as satisfied as I am with this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Blackie

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money but be VERY careful when using as Pole saw.
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for what I want to do primarily as a chain saw. However, it’s NOT a an easy Pole saw to use due to its unbalanced weight. This would be true of any electric or gas pole saw so it’s not a knock on this particular one. As a chain saw, it’s very well put together and easy to use. The chain tensioning is easy. Over all great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing, chain does not fall
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw worked great! Cut much larger branches than I thought! After doing some research I went with this brand and was not disappointed. Some reviewers complain about the chain falling, this has not happened to me once in the month that I've been using it. I read a review that said tighten the chain hard, so I did. Maybe that's the trick? Don't forget to buy your chainsaw oil! Manual says something about pushing a button to oil the chain but this model does not require that, it's automatic. It does get a little heavy at full extension, but that will happen with any chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I give it five star because of price and attachments. Just be aware that if you buy be sure to get bar & chain oil, not included with this product. Yes it is a little heavy when using pole but that’s to be expected. Durability and cutting is a plus for this little 10 inch. Absolutely no kick back whatsoever on this saw. Pole attachment is very secure. Fantastic for trimming trees around the yard or cutting up firewood. Other brands don’t have auto tension and oil levels so be careful of which brand you buy, always read reviews, price isn’t always the best brand.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye10

customer_reviews.title: WORX WG310 8" 8A Electric Power Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: Fast ship - seller was quick, product as described and other than being a bit "top heavy" when it's fully extended it did the job well. WORX tools are decent units, my Wife and I agree! Buy with confidence, I'll look up the seller if and when I need more tools. Thanks! Robert
customer_reviews.author: Robertó Montalban

customer_reviews.title: Nice operating small saw
customer_reviews.text: Pro's -- compact size is easy to maneuver on branches; easily cuts through branches and small trees (I went through 10" circumference with no problem); smooth cutting with recommended hydraulic bar oil; easy to adjust Con's -- top-heavy weight over head is tricky, so follow instructions to the letter; FINDING the recommended hydraulic oil was not easy as most do not specify the viscosity (I wound up buying one and then decided to buy one I was sure had the proper viscosity -- that was on line also). The biggest draw back I found was that it leaked oil after you stopped using it, regardless if you opened the cap to release the pressure or not.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw-Real heavy 6' in the air
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw works flawlessly, cuts through large wood like butter. My major complaint is when attached to pole, way to heavy to maneuver that far in the air. Pole needs to be telescopic and unit could be lighter. I have many WORX products and Love them all. I use this saw quite a bit, but am disappointed with the weight when attached to pole, which is main purpose I purchased it for. Perhaps if you are 6'-6'5" and 200 pounds, it would be real easy in the air? Great product, just not for my intended use of high tree trimming.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, it is a little heavy when fully ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, it is a little heavy when fully extended, but not unmanageable. I purchased this to cut down a large cherry tree, and without it I do not think I could have done the job. My only complaint is that the motor sticking out the side sometimes gets in the way of a cut if you are in the tree and cutting out, but turning the saw upside down solved that problem the few times I ran into it. My wife also likes the size of the 10 inch saw when its not on the pole. I probably made 100 cuts with it in the course of 2 weeks. Great saw, wish I would have purchased this long ago.
customer_reviews.author: digid

customer_reviews.title: worked when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Got it put it together sat on my bench for a month weather and just got busy did not have the time to use it. First time today cut down a crap mertel chain came off with in the first 5 branches cut from the bush. reinstalled the chain OH WELL will not stay on again and again off and off finished cutting down the bush with a sawzall. this is the second one that I have bought same manufacture same problem... Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: automatic chain tension thing didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great - problem was I made 20 cuts and had to put the chain back on maybe 10 times... used it one day and am returning it and will buy something that's better built.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: awesome, but two things...
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. Only acouple of saws on the market let you use it as a pole saw. Two things to keep in mind with this. One reviews say the chain falls off all the time but to keep this from happening once your ready to tighten the chain, pull the chain bar away from the saw then tighten. Fixed it for me at least. Two, this saw is HEAVY at 10 feet away. But if you need a 2 in 1 chain saw, this is the one for sure
customer_reviews.author: Kellinicole13

customer_reviews.title: Love Worx tools
customer_reviews.text: I really needed this tool to cut down low hanging branches before a storm approached. However I found that I could not handle this pole saw if I wanted to. I am too short and found it awkward to handle. The chainsaw itself works great and I have been able to cut up a number of tree trunks that had been felled earlier by storms. I will have a friend use the pole saw to cut down the branches for me. I still love all of my other worx tools that pure awesome and a godsend for women to use. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Only a few uses and started smoking and broke
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago and only really used it this summer. Started smoking and unable to cut after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I loved it but it did not love me back.
customer_reviews.text: This saw worked amazing at first! But unfortunately did not make it past the first tree. I was cutting 8” or less branches after I downed a good sized tree and was going great until the chain stopped spinning but the motor kept going. I am going to have to get something else because now I have a mess in my yard. I really wish this saw held up.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need -
customer_reviews.text: Good price, delivery on time, easy assembly. More modern than the similar Remington it replaced - has auto-oiling a break down handle (that is a few inches longer than the Remington it replaced which didn't have the break don feature) and easy adjustable chain. Used it today and plenty powerful cutting large oleanders (5 inch trunks). Yes the simple (large dial) chain adjustment is a bonus. I've already gotten my money's worth out of it and the chain is still serviceably sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Gin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. Both but my neighbors on both sides have massive oak trees that completely cover my back yard and hang over the back of my roof....Ate thru them no issue cut perfectly. Went thru 6-8 branches like butter. Yes its a bit top heavy when extended but that is to be expected. Cuts like butter......Would definately recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw.
customer_reviews.text: Love this pole saw. A little top heavy when you fully extend the pole but it cuts quickly. So much more quiet than I had expected. Trimmed up 4 trees and still have an almost full tank of oil. Being able to detach the saw from the pole helps with cutting the branches up into smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Breighner

customer_reviews.title: Unstable for reaching out. Chain goes dull fast
customer_reviews.text: Flemsy pole makes reaching out for distant branches hard. Very unstable and feels like stability pole is going to snap. Easy to assemble. Easy to use. Chain is already too full to cut effectively after about 20 branches
customer_reviews.author: dale adamson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chainsaw. You have to be extremely careful because there is an electric cord attached. It cuts very well. It does require a lot of maintenance and the instructions for doing so are not the best. I took it apart to clean it and it took me a little while to figure out how to get the chain back on. I haven’t used the pole yet so I can’t comment on it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive pole saw
customer_reviews.text: I decided to trim trees in my backyard myself and save few hundred dollars. The saw impressed me with its performance, cutting thick branches with easy. Few tips, 1) make sure you get high gauge extension cord otherwise saw might struggle. 2) Get chainsaw oil, it doesn't come with it. 3) Don't rush, just the saw work it's pace. it's small but it'll eventually nibble through thick branches 4) Make sure you clean the saw and tighten the chain frequently.
customer_reviews.author: R. S**g

customer_reviews.title: Chain came off on 1st time using
customer_reviews.text: used once after 3rd branch was cut chain came off kicked back and cut my Grandson's leg 10 stiches later we won't use it again Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Redford

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: decent price, extends well, cuts (not quickly, but gets the job done, if it went faster, I believe more accidents would happen) you have to be very careful Dislike-it is quite top heavy, which is to be expected when extended fully. You must stop cutting right before the branch is completely severed or your weight will drop the saw quickly & you could get hurt. If you respect the saw, it will be a great tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my 2nd year of trimming the neighbors' trees that encroach on my yard with this saw. One of the trees is huge and this saw just cuts through the larger branches like a hot knife through butter. I have to extend it all the way to reach the top branches and it's a little unwieldy at that height but you only need a few up to maybe 20 seconds of balancing to power through bigger branches. Even my neighbors were impressed with it. I haven't had to adjust the chain with all the use and I make sure the oil compartment is full. I couldn't be happier with this saw - highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Attaching the saw to the pole takes a bit of effort because the trigger switch on the saw has to be depressed by the pole attachment while fastening the retaining plate on the opposite side of the saw handle. After attaching the saw to the pole a couple times it becomes easier. Just a learning curve thing. With the pole fully extended you don’t have much pressure control on the chain so the saw doesn’t cut as fast. Overall the saw itself is as good or better than other electric saws I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Ilona M Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Great for your average home owner!
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is awesome! I had a 10’ cedar to cut down, it had a 8” trunk at the base. This chainsaw handled it with no problems! I also trimmed some 3-4” diameter pine limbs with no trouble. It really makes quick work of cutting the limbs into smaller pieces too. It converts from chainsaw to polesaw very fast. Great buy and I hope to have many years of service out of the saw.
customer_reviews.author: RyeBread

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting power.
customer_reviews.text: It works great except for the fact that the tensioner is screwy. You have to back it off and then re tighten it if chain ever gets loose, but at the same time the tensioner itself pivots on the twist knob, so you don't know if it's actually tensioned up or not it's either super tight or hanging off. I've been using chainsaws and such for almost 30 years and I haven't seen one yet that didn't need a little slack in the chain but this one apparently is either tight or loose, no in between.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil
customer_reviews.text: I bought my saw last year and ran it a few times with no issues. Bought bar and chain oil as suggested by Q&A, etc. I didn't get much use out of it until this year and it worked well. Chain came off a couple times, not a huge issue, but the main issue I am having is oil leaking. I do not over-fill it. Everything seems to be intact, but it just leaks everywhere. I came into my garage with a puddle of oil one day. I clean my saw basically after every use. I am not sure what can be done, but if it continues to do this I will need to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have some overgrown trees in my back years that needed to be cut back. I bought this because the reviews looked good and I’ve used worx for other tools and liked them. My one issue with this was the pool bent on first use, but I think it was a defect. I called the manufacturer and they sent me a replacement with no hassle. The saw itself works great and cuts through limbs like butter, just add oil occasionally and make sure to make clean straight cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pole saw. Works better than I thought it would. The photos show some of the trimming I did in one day. I didn’t use a ladder, so the shots reflect the reach I got from the ground. It maintains chain tension well, but I did manage to pop the chain off the bar when a branch near the end of my reach pinched the bar. The chain went back on the bar easily, and there is a graphic on the bar to remind the direction the cutter should face. Overall, it is a very well thought out tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Shallenberger

customer_reviews.title: Pole Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to avert paying those who continually stop by to get my business trimming two oak trees in my front yard. The saw works well - cuts very quickly just like a gas chain saw and works well on the end of a long pole. The only concern I had was the heaviness of the saw when you have to cut at an angle where the weight become a burden. I watched a YouTube video on this saw and was impressed at the size of the limbs it was being used on. This is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Albert L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, light, well built.
customer_reviews.text: I was about to buy an electric pole saw at a discount tool/trailer store when I spotted this on Amazon. So glad I did. This Worx setup is easier to use, lighter and looks to be better built. Easy to set-up - add oil, put the chain on and go (of course read the instructions for safety). It made fast work of a 4" blow down I had in my driveway. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ski

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This was surprising good quality and value. It works really well on branches up to five inches thick. My only complaints are that when fully extended it is really unwieldy and you will need to be strong to operate it extended. Also it automatically feeds oil to the chain and I would like to be able to give it a boost at times but you cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Oakhurst United Methodist

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been wary about purchasing one, but I’m glad we did. It is easy to assemble and reaches farther than expected. One of the best features is the location of the cord. We have several electrical lawn tools that we have accidentally cut or the line has gotten tangle or caught around the tools because of the placement of the cord. This works great, and it hasn’t caused any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Welch Family

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. All pole saws become heavy when fully extended and held at arms length. This one is no exception so be ready for that. The hand dial to tighten the blade is a great innovation that all these saws should have. Very happy with it and would buy it again. Haven't tested the warranty yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Saved a ton trimming trees my self. The pole extends nicely, its well made and I was able to cut down three trees and do a ton of trimming. An excellent value, super happy with the purchase. You do need to makes sure the chain is tight after three or four cuts or the chain will come off. It is super easy to do, loosen the big nut, pull the bar and tighten. Takes less than 10 seconds. Much easier than loosening bolts and and tightening.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil, otherwise good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Heavy and awkward when fully extended. These leak when stored, read about this in several reviews. Store on newspaper or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: ShredderX

customer_reviews.title: Good saw and pole!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent machine for around the home use, it seemed to easily cut through branches less than 3” diameter. The only issue is the chain came off a couple of times which is easy enough to maintain and I only wrote this review to make others aware of the chain issue. Otherwise, it worked flawlessly in pruning my oak trees in the yard. Oh, and there was a little kick back at times but did not feel underpowered or dull. I have a gas powered echo 16” bar saw for larger jobs but this is adequate for light work.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver
customer_reviews.text: It just gets the job done. Assembly was easy and it’s simple to switch between pole use and standard chainsaw use. Like any pole saw, it can be unwieldy when fully extended and caution is needed to deal with the extra weight at the end of the pole. The saw has plenty of power for small to medium sized limbs and the self oiling system works well. All in all a great value.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Has Removable Saw
customer_reviews.text: The only thing we didn't like was the weight. It was heavy to lift to reach the branches to be cut. But we did it. The best thing was the fact that it had a removable saw that could be used to cut up the rest of the branches when they were on the ground. The others had the saw built onto the pole, and not removable. That would make cutting up the rest of the branches very awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Tomaselli

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed to cut down some trees in my backyard and this is great. The chain saw is removable from the pole so you can use it either way. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It did the job with ease.
customer_reviews.text: I really cant say anything negative about this product. I had no issues that other reviewers reported. I needed it to cut off some rather large limbs from an ash tree and it performed well. This is not a heavy duty saw that you can expect to use all day or for really large wood, but for cleanups and occasional use on limbs and smaller trees, its an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Les62

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, I cleaned a fence line that more than half filled the city truck.
customer_reviews.text: Not very stable when fully extended and difficult to see and the bar and be accurate. Too much weight on the end of a weak pole. But it works. The ability to use without the pole is with the trade off. I will use it more without the pole. It cut down a 7" tree without a problem. Had to adjust chain five times. (Once because I got it pinched. ) It stayed adjusted for hours after the "break-in period". I'll keep using it and see how it is long term.
customer_reviews.author: rrsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning up and flexible!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great tool for the average homeowner. You can use it to trim up trees and keep them looking fresh with the pole attachment. Then take the saw off the pole and make quick work chopping up the limbs you trimmed off. Easily cuts through 7-8 inch logs. The convenience of electric means you can stop/start at your own pace and no fumes from the gas chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Yarman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a city slicker
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a fantastic unit. Pros: Easy to control Not loud (wont annoy neighbors) Pole works great, use it all the time. Don't have to worry about servicing small engines Cons: Cain tension system is a little wonky, took me a a few times to get it adjusted correctly. Leaks oil slowly in storage, but I feel most chainsaws do this. Just store it in a plastic bin or bag and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Benner

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted and much more than I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This is even better than I hoped for! We are using it mostly without the poll attachment and it is so light and easy to use! And the best part is NO two stroke gas mess around the house any more!
customer_reviews.author: Maximillian Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Chain get loose despite what other reviews say
customer_reviews.text: I had the issue with the chain coming loose. I tried all the recommendations from the reviews but nothing worked. I should have spent the money for a gas chainsaw instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw. I used it to cut down 20 foot tree in my yard all the way too the ground. The trunk diameter measured about 3 feet. Then I used it to cut down 3 trees in my uncles yard, not as big as mines but big enough. After that the ultimate test was a friend of mines 40 feet tree with a trunk that measured at 6 feet. This saw did the job. Cutting the large trunk requires some cutting skills but I was amazed of the power is this little saw.
customer_reviews.author: Dean G. Shillingford

customer_reviews.title: The Quality of Chain on the Chain Saw SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for 2 minutes barely, after purchasing it from Amazon in May I couldn't use it for a couple months and finally used it now. The chain on this is so poor in quality that I just trimmed 2 palm branches - I mean green and not even solid wood and the chainsaw has lost all teeth...no bite, no further cutting...it just became plain on the cutting end!! I was totally flabbergasted on the poor quality of this chain.....horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Randeep S Arora

customer_reviews.title: Really good chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do some tree branch pruning. It is great. I really like it also for lower branch trimming. I was able to cut 4-5 inch diameter branches with it easily. At full extension, it is a little heavy if you are going to be at it for a few hours, but I haven't used one that has been any better. Has a pretty good trigger and handle at least.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Barrese

customer_reviews.title: Comes down to the Oil
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, once i had it up and running this was a solid buy and great value. Biggest concern is the lack of a dead man stop or break. Kind of dangerous if you're not careful (Can take 3+ seconds to stop). Real reason for the low review is that the item should scream out "Buy oil with this so you don't have to go to the store". I would have bought the thing in a store rather than online if i had realized i had to go to the store anyway.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, works well, chain stays on if you know how to run a saw
customer_reviews.text: Works well, chain falls off if you torq on it or slam it into branches. Minor inconvenience flr a cheap saw. I did 12 or so trees amd had it fall off 3 or 4 times. Great little saw for the price, and being able to use it without the pole is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: james moore

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool and work as expected for its size it’s doing what I need it for, I cut up a tall large tree that fell in my yard after strong storm. It some manoeuvring and applying some tricks to cut big trunks but it done the job. What’s strange that big box it came in surely has some room for a small bottle of oil that it require before using, so unfortunately you’ll have to buy the oil separately!!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well
customer_reviews.text: Only problem was that instructions say to pump bulb for oiler before each cut but there is no bulb, it's self oiling. Very easy to assemble. Easy to use. Did not experience chain coming loose as some others mentioned, however I did tighten the chain before use. Very good value. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Difficult when using pole extension
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult when using pole extension as unit is heavy causing pole to bow somewhat.. well made but need to be strong to use..
customer_reviews.author: Mp

customer_reviews.title: Chain won't stay on
customer_reviews.text: I have used this saw sparingly over the past year. The pole feature is heavy, but that is to be expected. The most enfuriating problem with this saw is the chain comes loose about every other cut. It has always been like this and after a year of use I'm likely going to throw it away since I have to stop every other cut to put the chain back on track.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad unit for price
customer_reviews.text: Trimming limbs from several trees. I am 81 and my elbows hurt all the time so this unit is a bit heavy for me. The oil reservoir is a bit small so you must check it frequently. Being new the chain tends to stretch so be careful and check often. Otherwise I like the unit and have no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Navtalk

customer_reviews.title: Does little jobs well.  But the chain seems to loosen easily.
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great for women, easy to handle and to get the job done. Two problems, the chain needs frequent adjustment, and the plastic housing covering the chain has cracked???? Need help here?
customer_reviews.author: betty wilson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a little beast!
customer_reviews.text: My expectations were not very high given the price of the pole saw, but I was pleasantly surprised to see this thing cut branches about 4 inches in diameter with absolutely no difficulty. I just bought a property and have been pruning lots of trees, the pole was great as I did all the pruning without ever getting on a ladder! I would highly recommend this saw, don't lets its small size fool you, its a beast!
customer_reviews.author: Cruzin

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product design at it's best!
customer_reviews.text: Decades ago I used my father's electric chainsaw—a dismal experience—and I've used several gas powered chainsaws since. This Ryobi electric polesaw is one of the most intelligently designed tools I have ever owned. Assembly is intuitive and tool-less, the motor is powerful enough to deal with 6" plus branches, conversion from polesaw to handheld is quick and easy. extension rod system is amazing. The product designers have raised the bar really high with this device. It is a joy to use. The only downside is a bit of oil leakage during storage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Longstaff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to the lawn care collection
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great. Took down about 25 limbs from 1 to 6 inches. Oak and birch. Cuts great. Very nice to not have to deal with a two cycle engine for small jobs. The saw works very well on the pole. I especially like the handheld feature for cutting branches once they're down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good product for the price, for the job.
customer_reviews.text: This did exactly what I needed. The extra power contributes to the weight which I can accept. The chain does tend to jump the sprocket but is easily reattached. This occurs when one stresses its performance limits. Proper operation by the book us required including regular topping off of oil. .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No oil
customer_reviews.text: The saw did not come with oil. I had to run out to the store and buy bar and chain oil. The oil reservoir needs to be refilled after each use, Also, it's heavy when using it with the pole extension .. don't let the promo videos fool you, Nevertheless, the saw works great.
customer_reviews.author: Man from St.Pete

customer_reviews.title: This is a workhorse of a tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the other pole saw (different brand) that I recently purchased that was a complete piece of junk. The problem I had with the other unit was that the chain kept coming off and I could not keep it on for more than a minute at a time. I used this worx saw (both as a pole saw and chain saw) for about 3 hours nonstop and the chain never came off 1 time. It cut through small branches, big branches, and everything in between. I have 2 other worx products that are very high quality and make yard work so much simpler. I should have known and purchased this from the start. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It's work great. I had to cut big branches off my apple trees. NO PROBLEMS!!! The pole was was long enough and it cut right through. Extremely easy to assemble. You can use it as a hand chainsaw or attach it to the pole. It's not too heavy and easy to put on the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Delehanty

customer_reviews.title: This Item probably works well but is top heavy
customer_reviews.text: This Item probably works well but is top heavy, It could throw people off balance. Reading the instructions there is many thing you should avoid not to get hurt.. That's why I returned it otherwise looks to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Geno70

customer_reviews.title: Use the chainsaw's weight to cut limbs, work smarter not harder
customer_reviews.text: Works great, especially for the price. Don't let people fool you with the "it's heavy when extended" because they're using it improperly. The weight of the saw should be resting on branch/limb as the blade cuts through. The ability to use it as a stand alone chainsaw is great! Cool down then limbs then remove the pole and cut em down to waste bin size 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and use
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time, my sons used it right away to cut down limbs around the yard and they loved it. We still have more to cut down. I’ll come back and write a further review once we use it more often. So far, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: salford

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice!
customer_reviews.text: Literally took out a tree with this little guy. Threw the chain one time, but I tightened it up and have had no issues since!
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

customer_reviews.title: Yes and No
customer_reviews.text: it was bought as a Father’s Day gift in May and was first used over the weekend and I’m not happy with the product and the window to return has closed. However upon speaking with someone they have agreed to the return. Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Worx product, but....
customer_reviews.text: Another trusty product from Worx. Easy to assemble. However, I am 5'-2", this item is very heavy when it's on the pole. It's just me, I'm short and not very strong. I was exhausted after 2 minutes trying to balance this tool. Solid product though. Remember to get oil beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: MadcatMorga

customer_reviews.title: Easy saw to work with
customer_reviews.text: All I needed to do was to add bar oil and I was off and trimming old dead branches. It cut through them like butter. With the extension I was able to reach the hard to get ones. The only complaint I have is , it didn’t load my truck.
customer_reviews.author: John Norman

customer_reviews.title: Had it running within minutes of opening the box, helped take down a fairly tall tree.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tall but smallish tree (14' high but wispy) taken down but couldn't just chop into the base as it would have fallen on my garage, house, shed, or neighbor's fence depending on which direction it was felled. This great little saw helped me take the branches and top out without getting on a ladder. Probably saved me $500+ in arborist expenses. Easy to assemble and surprisingly powerful for being corded and tiny + inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Fancypants

customer_reviews.title: Better than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: It's a little heavy at full length, but gotta expect that. Cuts very well, extended or as a hand-held chainsaw. Switches easily between the two. Cleaning is easy and lubrication is auto. Was apprehensive about this brand, but it's delivered each time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: JC in G'ville

customer_reviews.title: 8" is better if you just want a pruner. It will cut up to 4" Diameter.
customer_reviews.text: Item is $20 cheaper on eBay and And ships direct from manufacturer. Just saying. The 8" is about half the price and if you already have a chainsaw that will cut a 6" log go for the 8". It's half a pound lighter 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed trees at my rental unit. It worked perfect. The chainsaw part attaches/ detaches in seconds. The pole can be a little top heavy. Otherwise, I went through everything in a matter of hours. Ensure you order chain oil too.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl O

customer_reviews.title: Trimming my trees
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw. The extension gives me the ability to trim the tall branches from the ground. Taking off the pole to the use the chain saw itself to chop up the branches into smaller pieces makes this saw very versatile. Now I'm just trying to find more trees to trim.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pham

customer_reviews.title: It was too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I picture something more light weiagt that I would be able maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great little pole saw.
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked great for me.it is heavy when fully extended but if you use the weight to cut to your advantage and keep the fully extended pole saw near vertical it's completely doable. The oiler worked fine on mine and when the pole is retracted it's easy to use,it's a tough little saw.i cut tree branches with mine from half an inch in diameter to about 3 inches,I'm glad I picked this tool it really did a good job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Smitch

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for son in laws a gift. Gets the job done. Electric which makes life easy if you have a long extension cord. Husband had one which he loves. Great for trimming tree limbs in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: C Kelly

customer_reviews.title: My Dad Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my dad to cut tree limbs on his property. He loves how easy it is to use and disassemble. He likes that he is able to purchase replacement or additional parts from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well, Extension pole is great !!!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the saw on the pole it is top heavy but I really don't know how you could engineer this out. Remote switch and control of the saw while extended out is great. Used it for trimming tree and bush branches I Previously cut with a manual pole saw -- This is much better !!!! Overall I am very happy with the product. RussK----
customer_reviews.author: Russell G. Kleinbauer

customer_reviews.title: Get it get it get it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal and worked wonderfully out of the box. Just be sure to order the chain oil. You will need it and it is not included in with the saw. I used it out of the box to cut up a tree that had fallen. Like a knife through butter. Loved it. Low noise. My wife commented that she never even heard anything when I came in to say it was all cut up. The tree was about three foot around at the base. For a great all around tool, this is it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Francis J. Pirozzi

customer_reviews.title: Homeowners DIY gift, $500 saved
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed how easy it was to assemble and use this pole saw. I had done a quotation from tree guys $500. I decided to buy this from amzon and put it to test. Easy to use and pretty cute stumps faster. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeZILLA

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a gas powered saw.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power. Sharp saw. You do not have to apply much pressure. Cuts great off the pole as a hand saw too. Check the tension on the chain every few cuts and manual tighten the chain if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut tree branches. Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kelley

customer_reviews.title: WORX WG309 8 Amp 10" 2-in-1 Electric Pole Saw & Chainsaw with Auto-Tension
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (If you actually read the instructions). Very versatile and actually does everything that it is reported to do. I have never worked with a "self adjusting" saw and actually over tightened the adjuster initially. When I realized what was going on and just tightened "finger" tight everything has worked amazingly! Wonderful product as long as you have the balance and upper body strength to do what you are trying to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: very nice I was so tired of trying to start my ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice I was so tired of trying to start my gas one this you can plug and go and does a nice job with out the loudness of gas UPDATE..... STILL ROCKS FILL THE OIL AND PLUG IT IN DOES ITS JOB I DO REALLY MISS PULLING ON THE CORD OF A GAS ONE AND MIXING GAS AND TUNNING IT ALL THE TIME GETTING IT RUNNING KILLER AT HOME ONLY TO HAVE IT NOT!!! START WHEN NEEDED OH BOY DO I MISS ALL THAT JUNK HAHAHA NOT!!!
customer_reviews.author: honest mans answer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Saw - useful, maneuverable, effective
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. It’s versatile, easy to maneuver and use, and effective. Useful for cutting down limbs and small trees. See the accompanying picture for examples of trees we cut down with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian S

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, however...
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for a few hours this past weekend taking down branches of an evergreen. Totally easy to assemble + use, but the chain kept coming off + when it did, caused the inside of the part that was holding the saw together to get worn down/scraped....first use. Several hours. Already worn...Concerned that it won't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Many expectations that weren't satisfied using this pole saw. didn't cut as good or sharp as I expected, nor trimmed branches easily. Maybe that's ALL pole chain saw's problems, and I probably had too high expectation.
customer_reviews.author: biteme

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Remington that died on me....note, these are not commercial grade Husqvarna saws, and if a "friend" borrows it, they may go full lumberjack with it....which is why the Remington died.....but for general light residential use you can't go wrong. Better than the Remington with auto lube and chain tensioner. Easily detaches from the pole and easy for my wife to use.....as long as she doesn't hit rocks or concrete. Buy an extra chain for those days.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE

product_meta.title: WORX WG310 8" 8A Electric Power Pole Saw, Black and Orange
product_meta.description: Style:8” Electric Pole SawThe WORX 2-in-1 pole saw and chainsaw is unique and multifunctional. Attach the 10-foot extension pole to reach higher limbs without using a ladder – detach the pole to easily chop up the fallen limbs. The pole attaches with no tools making it quick and convenient to transition from a chainsaw to a pole saw. This low-maintenance saw has a patented auto-tensioning chain system to help extend the life of the bar and chain. In addition, the automatic, tool-free chain tensioning system and automatic oil pump with level indicator makes it even easier to operate and maintain. The WORX WG310 has a powerful 8 Amp motor and versatile design, making it the perfect yard tool for light to medium duty trimming, limbing, pruning, and clean up around the yard.
feature_bullets: Patented auto-tension chain system for extended bar & chain life
Powerful 8 amp motor offers a consistent performance
Automatic chain lubrication with oil lever indicator
Reach up to 10-feet with the pole fully extended

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars37 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
